main event: An unidentified aerial object was observed from the ground at Manhattan Beach, California on July 27, 1952.
interesting points: The object was elliptical or delta shaped, and appeared to the naked eye to be about the size of a dime. It was a bright silver color with gray in the rear.
When first sighted, it appeared as one object, but later broke up into seven objects. There were no exhaust trails or sounds.
The seven objects were grouped in a V formation, with three in the lead and two formations of two each following.
The entire sighting was very gracefully executed, with the object turning south and disappearing at a high speed and altitude.
The witness was an ex-Navy pilot now employed as an aircraft engineer, and the sighting was verified by seven other people.
sighted object: an elliptical or delta-shaped object that broke up into seven parts
